diagnosis.final_diagnosis: probable sporadic Creutzfeldt-Jacob disease (sCJD), Heidenhain variant
differential_diagnosis: ophthalmologic processes (e.g., subretinal hemorrhage in macular degeneration, retinal trauma, chorioretinitis, or vasculitis)
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The rapid onset of symptoms, the cortical ribboning pattern on MRI, and abnormal EEG findings led to the consideration of Creutzfeldt-Jacob disease. The patient's visual distortions and cognitive symptoms, the MRI findings, and positive CSF tests for 14-3-3 protein and elevated t-tau protein supported the diagnosis of sCJD.
